newsitem.title: USA: Health Mgmt Systems sees Q4 revs, EPS down.
newsitem.headline: Health Mgmt Systems sees Q4 revs, EPS down.

text.p: Health Management Systems Inc said on Friday that it expects to report total revenue of $23 million to $24 million and earnings per share of about $0.15 to $0.16 in the the fourth quarter ended October 31.
In the year-ago quarter, it had revenue of $24.7 million and earnings per share of $0.17.
The company also said it expects fiscal 1996 revenue of slightly more than $100 million and earnings per share of about $0.45 to $0.46.
In fiscal 1995 the company had revenue of $86.7 million and earnings per share of $0.57.
Health Management shares plunged 8-1/4 Friday morning to 13-7/8 at 1014 EDT.

The company attributed the lower results to a number of factors, including the creation of a reserve to cover a fee that a large client is debating and a request from another client that HMS defer completion on a work order until January, Health Management said.
The company also said the restructuring of its relationship with HHL Financial Services Inc, a major customer, "consumed more management resources than anticipated."
The company said it plans to release final fourth quarter results November 26.
